metadata.Title: CVE-2018-1058 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in the way Postgresql allowed a user to modify the behavior of a query for other users. An attacker with a user account could use this flaw to execute code with the permissions of superuser in the database. Versions 9.3 through 10 are affected.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-1058` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libecpg-compat3 - 9.5.12-0ubuntu0.16.04
libecpg6 - 9.5.12-0ubuntu0.16.04
libpgtypes3 - 9.5.12-0ubuntu0.16.04
libpq5 - 9.5.12-0ubuntu0.16.04
postgresql-9.5 - 9.5.12-0ubuntu0.16.04
postgresql-client-9.5 - 9.5.12-0ubuntu0.16.04
postgresql-contrib-9.5 - 9.5.12-0ubuntu0.16.04
postgresql-plperl-9.5 - 9.5.12-0ubuntu0.16.04
postgresql-plpython-9.5 - 9.5.12-0ubuntu0.16.04
postgresql-plpython3-9.5 - 9.5.12-0ubuntu0.16.04
postgresql-pltcl-9.5 - 9.5.12-0ubuntu0.16.04
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: postgresql-9.5 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '9.5.12-0ubuntu0.16.04').
